summary:
The CVE-2020-12763 vulnerability affects TRENDnet ProView Wireless camera TV-IP512WN 1.0R 1.0.4. The vulnerability arises due to an unauthenticated stack-based buffer overflow when handling RTSP packets. The exploitation of this vulnerability may result in remote code execution or denial of service. The vulnerability exists in the binary rtspd (in /sbin) when parsing a long 'Authorization: Basic' RTSP header. The vulnerability has a CVSS v3.1 base score of 9.8, indicating its criticality.

The possible solution to this vulnerability is to update the firmware version to the latest available version. The vulnerability is fixed in firmware version 1.1.1. If the device cannot be updated, the only solution is to block RTSP traffic to the device from untrusted sources. 

It is recommended that users apply the necessary updates and maintain caution when handling sensitive information. Users should also be vigilant in monitoring their networks for any suspicious activity.
